articles.title: From Tiffany to Target, stores are boarding up windows in case of election unrest
articles.description: Retailers across the country are stepping up security measures to try to head off any damages to their stores during election-related protests in the coming days.

articles.title: 'What a coward': Cohen reacts to Trump hinting he'd fire Fauci
articles.description: CNN's Elizabeth Cohen reacts to President Trump hinting he'll fire Dr. Anthony Fauci, saying Trump should have the "guts" not to wait until after the election is over if that is what he really wants to do.

articles.author: Analysis by Chris Cillizza, CNN Editor-at-large
articles.title: This is the best possible argument to vote for Donald Trump
articles.description: On Sunday, for the first time since 1972, the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette endorsed a Republican for president. And not just any Republican: Donald J. Trump.
articles.content:

articles.description: Can you vote in person if you are currently recovering in isolation from Covid-19 or quarantining from being exposed to the virus? Yes, if you take appropriate precautions, the CDC says.

articles.title: Voters who are sick or in quarantine with Covid-19 can still vote, CDC says. Here's how to do it safely
articles.description: Put on a mask, sanitize your hands and stay at least 6 feet away from others.

articles.title: Russia's 'Sausage King' killed with a crossbow in a sauna

articles.title: See new show at Machu Picchu
articles.description: Authorities in Peru have put on a show to mark the re-opening of the major archaeological site that was closed to the public for almost eight months.
